top_categories.workout_context: La Resistance rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
La Resistance’s french alpine gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at La Resistance when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
La Resistance’s french alps, alpine gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing La Resistance isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of La Resistance. Make this intensity feel like home.
La Resistance’s 5,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
La Resistance’s french alpine gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for La Resistance’s 5,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at La Resistance — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at La Resistance intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at La Resistance — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on french alpine gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for La Resistance’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at La Resistance. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at La Resistance requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on french alpine gravel to build confidence. Expect: french alps, alpine gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, VO2max, and Over Under to prepare you for 65 miles of french alpine gravel in French Alps.
